newsitem.title: USA: U.S. aluminum shipments fall 3.3 pct Jan to Feb.
newsitem.headline: U.S. aluminum shipments fall 3.3 pct Jan to Feb.

text.p: U.S. primary aluminum industry shipments in February, including exports, fell 3.3 percent to 1.782 billion pounds (808,302 tonnes) compared to January, but were up 5 percent on February last year, the Aluminum Association reported.
U.S. exports of aluminum ingot and mill products were reported at 248 million pounds in February, rising 15.5 percent over the previous year's total.
Imports in February were at 469 million pounds, down 3.2 percent from February 1996.
Shipments to domestic markets, including imports, in February totaled 1.535 billion pounds, up 3.5 percent over February 1996.
Year to date domestic shipments rose 6.6 percent to 3.137 billion pounds.
During March the Association's order index dipped 2.3 points to 97.34 points from 99.62 points in the previous month.
Orders of canstock in March fell to 91.91 points from 97.07 points in February and 107.35 points in January.
